Trif Language

Trif is a multiparadigm language that blends the ergonomics of Python with the modularity of Node.js. It compiles to Python or JavaScript and ships with a batteries-included standard library for desktop, data, and web development.

Getting started Language tour Package manager Interoperability

Getting started

  1. Create a file hello.trif.
  2. Write the following:
fn main() {
    print("Hello, Trif!")
}

Run with python -m trif_lang run hello.trif.

Language tour

Trif supports functions, loops, conditions, parallelism via spawn and high-level data structures.

import std.io as io

fn greet(name) {
    io.println("Hi " + name)
}

fn main() {
    let names = ["Ada", "Linus", "Margaret"]
    for name in names {
        spawn greet(name)
    }
}

Package manager

Initialise packages with python -m trif_lang package init. Publish to the local registry and install dependencies offline.

Interoperability

Use runtime.import_module to call into Python packages, or compile to JavaScript to integrate with Node.js or modern browsers.
